text: Combine sugar, oil, ginger, shallots, and chile-garlic sauce in a blender or food processor. Blend until relatively smooth. Lay the tuna steaks in a 13" x 9" glass baking dish.  Pour the marinade from Step 1 into the dish.  Turn the tuna steaks over to ensure that they are fully coated.  Refrigerate for 1 hour.  Flip the tuna steaks. Refrigerate for another hour. Light the grill.  Add salt and pepper to both sides of the tuna.  Grill the steaks until done. For medium rare, grilling time should be about 4 minutes Serve. These are delicious served hot off the grill, but can also be refrigerated and eaten cold (or even at room temperature!) later.
